Key Match Events: Rohit Sharma hit a trademark pull shot into the stands off Kagiso Rabada
Ngidi became the first bowler in the tournament to dismiss Virat Kohli
Suryakumar Yadav hit three sixes and six fours in a remarkable 40-ball stay that brought him 68
David Miller clinched the win with consecutive boundaries off Bhuvneshwar, with two balls left in the final over
Pre-Game Insights: Rohit Sharma’s decision to bat first after winning the toss appeared a brave one when faced with a blistering South African pace onslaught on a rapid batting track
India were given something to bowl at, thanks to another extraordinary counter attack by Suryakumar Yadav
South Africa appeared behind the game, but a 76-run partnership between Aiden Markram and David Miller, who both made half-centuries, proved decisive
Post-Match Reflections: When you see that score, you always think that you are in the game because the pitch is such that a wicket can come at any time
That was a match-winning partnership from Markram and Miller. We were a little poor in the field, too. We gave too many chances and were not quite clinical
It was not good enough. The last two games we played we were pretty good in the field and we want to be consistent in that department
Miscellaneous Highlights: India were given something to bowl at, thanks to another extraordinary counter attack by Suryakumar Yadav
Although India’s bowlers employed a different method to that of their counterparts, their defence of 134 was both plucky and skillful
The swing of Arshdeep Singh and Bhuvneshwar Kumar – contrasted to the pace and ferocity of Ngidi and Co – reduced South Africa to 24 for three in their reply
